text: what do you think of this laptop dustin? Good for gaming? <http://www.razerzone.com/gaming-systems/razer-blade-pro> I think I am going to buy it soon.

attachments.title: The New Razer Blade Pro: Work and Play Gaming Laptop - 17" Notebook Display
attachments.text: The New Razer Blade Pro 17-inch gaming laptop is now equipped with 16GB DDR3L memory, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 860M and Intel Core i7.
attachments.fallback: Razer: The New Razer Blade Pro: Work and Play Gaming Laptop - 17" Notebook Display

text: Razer makes quality gear. I've been very impressed with them thus far, and like their products, though they do charge a premium price. The Blade is one of the nice options for a gaming laptop today. They pack a pretty good amount of power into a reasonably light frame. If you are determined to get a gaming laptop, the Blade is a good choice. However, as the owner of a previous gaming laptop (an Alienware m15x), I will caution you that there are limited upgrades that can be made to a laptop platform. Your gaming laptop will only be pushing top of the line for around 2 years, before things get beyond it's power. I've been a much bigger fan of having a lightweight midrange laptop (a dell XPS12 ultrabook) and a tricked out desktop for gaming. All that said, thinking about how and what you will use it for are always my primary questions anyway, so if portable gaming is your use case, the Blade is a nice option.

Yeah I am not a big gamer but could definitely get into it. I mainly want it for its speed and sleekness. two of my friends have them and they are great laptops. I was also looking at some alienware laptops but I think i like the blade a little bit better.
I'd get the blade over an Alienware for the weight alone
You want something you can carry, haha
yeah exactly. I think I am going to get it next week. Shipping is going to take forever though.
My alienware was like 13 lbs
My ultrabook is 4
haha yeah huge difference. My other friend just bought an alienware and its just too big
If you're going to get into PC games, you should begin by getting a steam account (<http://store.steampowered.com|store.steampowered.com>)
And then check the Humble Bundle every week to fill it up (<https://www.humblebundle.com/>)

attachments.title: Humble Square Enix Bundle
attachments.text: Square Enix has emerged from the tombs with a bundle full of treasured titles. Pay what you want for up to 16 games including selections from the Deus Ex, Thief, Hitman and Just Cause series!
attachments.fallback: Humble Bundle: Humble Square Enix Bundle

and Battlefield is one of the leaders in the modern FPS space, though they focus on large maps and team battles. Also vehicles

Cool integration of a photo system in The Last of Us for taking awesome screenshots. Monument Valley has a similar thing. As games get more and more graphically beautiful, I wonder if this sort of thing will become more common? (Some horror-ish images inside.
